page.title: 03MIDDLEWICH RIVERS
page.content: There are two rivers which flow through our block. Both are small but the larger is the River Wheelock and it was this that we took a closer look at. It enters the block from the south having risen at Mow Cop and flows northwards. Beyond the block it flows into the River Dane. The stretch of the river within the block measures 7 km. We chose a field just to the north of Sutton Mill to carry out our study. We found that it had an average depth of 0.5 metres and the average width was 7 metres. The speed of flow varied so we measured it at three points and calculated the average flow speed to be 27 metres per minute. We estimated from these measurements that the average volume of water flowing was 93 cubic metres per minute.
